ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Lots of practice with speaking, writing, and listening German. Covering many advanced grammatical topics very useful for formal/expository writing. Many opportunities to participate in live discussions in German, exposure to vocabulary relevant to a wide variety of modern sociopolitical issues.
Greater communication skills as well as grammar and new vocabulary pertaining to current events confronting Germany.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The course covered many current events and modern sociopolitical issues, so there was a topic of discussion for everyone. Class topics were very interesting and highly relevant. Flipped classroom format of watching materials on the topic then dedicating class to spoken discussions was very effective in creating an interactive seminar, giving students many opportunities to engage with class content and practice spoken German. Homework written pieces were also effective for practicing grammar topics and written German in general, and were enjoyable to prepare as they left much room for students to express their personal views on complex and relevant issues.
To even further improve this course, a bit more written materials could be integrated to further practice reading German, and maybe a few more student-led discussions or short presentations. Also, to balance out the workload, the two written essays could be done earlier so the second essay doesn't clash with the final project.
Using 13 Fragen was a good way to orient the course and present material. Watching the 13 Fragen youtube videos was easier for me than doing readings for homework.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to anyone studying German at L5, because it's a great way to practice spoken and written German through discussions of many important and interesting current issues (e.g. climate change and climate justice, army deployments and police violence, wealth inequality and universal basic income, justice and imprisonment, food justice, ...)
